image.altText: A man with white beard wearing a hat and sunglasses

props.synopsis: A man who groomed and sexually abused a nine-year-old Filipino girl after befriending her mother has been sentenced to 15 years' imprisonment.

title.children: Paedophile handed 15-year sentence for persistent sexual abuse of child overseas

image.altText: A woman holds an award in a room

props.synopsis: Professor Leah Bromfield, 46, was among those who led the charge for the first National Framework for Protecting Australia's Children in 2007.

title.children: Child protection advocate awarded Australian of the Year for SA

image.altText: A pub and a general store overlooking a river with a pine tree in the middle

props.synopsis: Anger at the closure of popular tourist attractions in the border town of Nelson over the past three years sparks a movement hoping to cut through bureaucracy and create a new plan for the future.

title.children: After years of hard knocks, residents rage against red tape 'quagmire' in bid to save tiny town

image.altText: Wide open windows overlook green trees, with an angular house constructed of red brick and rich wood

props.synopsis: Australia's best-designed new buildings have been lavished with praise at the national architecture awards, including a beach home "rich in detail and delight" as well as the embassy building in Washington.

title.children: Melbourne home, beach house and embassy in US among big winners at national architecture awards

image.altText: Yellow crime scene tape outside a house

props.synopsis: A man is found dead after a house was destroyed by a fire that police say appears to be suspicious, but investigators are yet to formally determine if the body is that of the 72-year-old resident.

title.children: Major Crime detectives investigating 'unexplained' death in Adelaide house fire

image.altText: A man in a suit and glasses carrying a bag walks along a sidewalk next to a sandstone-colored building

props.synopsis: Richard Boyle first became an internal whistleblower in 2017, when he became concerned about operations in the tax office.

title.children: Tax office whistleblower Richard Boyle set to stand trial

image.altText: Close of up young woman with brown curly hair, gazes seriously, wears black leather jacket, white blouse, necklace.

props.synopsis: The Adelaide singer and songwriter won no less than four awards including best new artist, best solo artist, and the most popular pop artist.

title.children: Solo artist Aleksiah wins big at the SA Music Awards as Guy Sebastian is inducted into hall of fame

image.altText: Tobacco wars presser

props.synopsis: South Australia has had 19 arson attacks believed to be related to the sale of illegal tobacco, while more than $5 million worth of illicit products have been seized.

title.children: Police crack down as tobacco wars spread into South Australia

image.altText: Man speaking with two other men.

props.synopsis: The NSW premier admits the state government needs to do better for regional communities during a meeting with hundreds of residents at Broken Hill.

title.children: 'Just not good enough': Minns tells Broken Hill work to be done to ensure regional NSW not left behind

image.altText: A man sitting at his computer

props.synopsis: More Australians are working from home and the flexible arrangements make it easy to see why, but what happens if you are injured while working from home? A South Australian case provides some answers.

title.children: Worker's compensation win for tripping over puppy fence at home raises questions about home office safety

image.altText: Donald Trump signs a page as a number of people stand around him

props.synopsis: Donald Trump will return to the White House with what he calls a "powerful mandate". Here's a look at the policies he's put forward.

title.children: From appointing Elon Musk to fracking: This is Trump’s to-do list for his second presidency

image.altText: Gemma Houghton follows through with kicking a ball, with a defender trying to smother

props.synopsis: Port Adelaide heads into its maiden AFLW finals match on a six-game winning streak but comes up against Richmond, the last team to beat it.

title.children: Port Adelaide and Richmond poised for blockbuster AFLW elimination final

image.altText: Orange Hospital sign

props.synopsis: Leaked documents show staff at the public hospital in Orange can no longer provide abortion services for patients who present without medical complications, further restricting regional women's access to time-critical reproductive health care.

title.children: Orange Hospital directs staff to no longer provide abortions to patients without 'early pregnancy complications'

image.altText: The sun rises over a beach

props.synopsis: Much of Australia is baking through the hottest spring weather in years this week as temperatures surge as much as 13 degrees Celsius above average.

title.children: Heatwave to linger this weekend and summer scorcher tipped by BOM

image.altText: Kevin Rudd smiles and points as he walks through the marble foyer of parliament house.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump thinks Kevin Rudd is "a little bit nasty" and "not the brightest bulb". It is an open question whether Australia's ambassador to America will be able to deal with the returning Trump administration.

title.children: Should he stay or should he go? Questions surround Rudd as government confronts Trump 2.0

image.altText: Biden standing at a podium on stage

props.synopsis: Instead of handing control of the White House to a new generation of Democratic leaders, Joe Biden will now suffer the ignominy of watching Donald Trump once again take the reins of power.

title.children: Joe Biden promised to hand over the torch to the next generation, but he incinerated Democrats instead

image.altText: A red house icon painted onto a yellow brick building with white text that reads "Chemist Warehouse".

props.synopsis: Two of Australia's biggest pharmacy brands are joining forces to become a multi-billion-dollar  pharmaceutical juggernaut. Here's why the competition watchdog gave the deal the all-clear.

title.children: Chemist Warehouse could become a bigger business than Coles after a merger deal

image.altText: german man speaks in front of the german flag and the EU flag

props.synopsis: The decision to sack Christian Lindner has thrown Europe's largest economy into political disorder and could have larger ramifications around the continent.

title.children: Germany in political disarray after ruling coalition collapses hours after US election

image.altText: A montage of three images of a three year old boy, with brown hair, smiling.

props.synopsis: Almost three years since NSW Police first went public with their theory that William Tyrrell's foster mother may have covered up his death, the evidence why is now being examined. But what was that evidence?

title.children: Police backed up their theory against William Tyrrell's foster mother. Little incriminating evidence was heard

image.altText: Ronan Keating, Storm Keating, CEO Jamie Wilson and guest arrive at The Emeralds and Ivy Ball.

props.synopsis: Australian politicians sang the praises of a tech entrepreneur’s startup, but one collapsed company was marred with problems.

title.children: A tech entrepreneur who linked arms with politicians and celebrities has had a company wound up over unpaid bills

image.altText: Typhoon Yinxing strikes Philippines

props.synopsis: It's the 13th storm to batter the South-east Asian archipelago this year, and comes just weeks after powerful storms in the Philippines left more than 150 people dead.

title.children: Philippines hit by Typhoon Yinxing while still recovering from deadly storms

image.altText: A shimmering flood plain with a mountain in the background.

props.synopsis: The nature repair market will operate similarly to the carbon market, only with a few major differences.

title.children: Can you put a price on nature? The federal government is giving it a shot

image.altText: White ship in dark ocean waters with clear blue sky

props.synopsis: Australia will begin building its next warships in either Germany or Japan after the government narrowed the field of designs for a contract worth $11 billion over the next decade.

title.children: Japan and Germany shortlisted for Australia's next warship program

image.altText: A box-like white building surrounded by other modern buildings, including one with yellow panels, tram and car passes in front.

props.synopsis: A woman diagnosed with dissociative identity disorder has switched identities in the witness box to give evidence about alleged child sexual abuse at the hands of her father.

title.children: Jury watches as woman switches to third alternate identity of a five year old in child sex abuse trial

image.altText: A mosquiton on the skin of a human host

props.synopsis: Researchers say climate change has the potential to increase mosquito numbers and the transmissibility of mosquito-borne diseases. With some people more prone to mosquito bites than others, experts have reinforced the need to protect yourself from getting bitten.

title.children: Do you get bitten by mosquitoes more than other people? Here's why

image.altText: A man in a face mask a jeans walks down steps.

props.synopsis: Two workers who helped peg down the jumping castle at a Tasmanian primary school on the day six students died have told a Devonport court of the moment they realised it had been lifted into the air.

title.children: Hillcrest jumping castle staff tell Devonport court of moment inflatable became airborne on tragic day

image.altText: A young girl in a dance costume with a blurred face.

props.synopsis: The man and his wife are being tried in court for starving their teenage daughter who was described by doctors as being "dangerously underweight".

title.children: Perth father accused of starving emaciated daughter admits controlling his family, verbally abusing wife

image.altText: Jackie holds up a green P plate with an insistent expression on her face from driver's seat in a car, wearing pink top, sunnies

props.synopsis: Audrey is a black comedy about a mum assuming her comatose daughter's identity to further her acting career, and a commentary on the societal expectations we place on mothers.

title.children: A teen actor falls into a coma and her family are thrilled: So begins absurd Australian comedy, Audrey

image.altText: A close up of a 'Regis Resources' sign.

props.synopsis: Regis Resources says it is launching a Federal Court action over an order granted by Environment Minister Tanya Plibersek that has halted progress on its mine in the New South Wales Central West.

title.children: Tanya Plibersek's Aboriginal protection order over NSW mining site to be legally challenged

image.altText: The word Cranbrook in gold on a sandstone column at the gates of a school.

props.synopsis: The federal education department says Sydney's prestigious Cranbrook School is refusing to table a review it conducted into its handling of child safety and other issues.

title.children: Cranbrook School accused of refusing to hand over child safety review to federal education department

image.altText: A white alpaca on a lead, held by a man in a black polo, is stroked on the neck by an elder woman in a hospital bed.

props.synopsis: Though the world may remember Hephner for his unforgettable sneeze on King Charles, the alpaca has already made a name for himself around Canberra through many philanthropic endeavours.

title.children: Hephner the alpaca is best known for sneezing on the King, but he spends more of his time comforting palliative care patients

image.altText: A man in profile, wearing a suit.

props.synopsis: The federal government is seeking powers to re-detain the 224 released "NZYQ" detainees if it can find another country to accept them, as well as powers to pay a foreign nation to take them.

title.children: New powers allow NZYQ group to be re-detained, and a foreign nation to be paid to accept them

image.altText: An older woman in a red-blonde bob wearing a patterned scarf walks out of a building with 'Palais de Justice' on it'

props.synopsis: An Australian advocacy group for older women's rights says they sent Gisele Pelicot the silk scarf as a marker of solidarity as she attends the trial of 51 men accused of raping her.

title.children: Gisele Pelicot wears First Nations scarf sent by Australian supporters in court

image.altText: Poo ball in test tube

props.synopsis: Authorities initially feared these balls could be made of toxic tar. Further testing from scientists indicated they are closer to 'fatbergs' typically found in sewers.

title.children: Hundreds of mysterious balls washed on Sydney beaches. Now we know the 'disgusting' substances in them
